title: WCAS PHIL 267-0-20 Philosophy, Race, and Racism

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Race and racism are subjects of obvious importance in the modern world. What insights can philosophy bring to the task of understanding them, and ultimately getting rid of racism (and perhaps even of race)? Though race is a very non-traditional subject in philosophy, the last twenty years or so have seen a growing body of work in the area. In this course we will look at such issues as: the history of racism; the conceptual analysis of racism; the "metaphysics" of race; the phenomenology of a racialized existence; the nature of "whiteness"; and the moral and political challenges posed by a racialized social world.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: By the end of the course, students should have a basic understanding of some of the philosophical issues raised by race and racism.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two essays and a final exam.
